intro: Heisteria duckei, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Heisteria duckei thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its vibrant flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds, contributing to its ecological value.
